評論內容:
Ward 20 ophthalmology ward…

Please extend my eternal gratitude to Professor Figueiredo and his team on shift today..

This extends, the porters , the anaesthetists, the support staff, the volunteers , the receptionists, basically the whole staff but special praise must go to the on duty shift today( namely Gemma the ward nurse and her colleague Aixy)

Not only was everybody so welcoming , professional and friendly whilst I was in for an operation but what really prompted me to type up this email is the fact that this exemplary service that went above and behind the call of duty and was on the back of some physical threats and a vicious verbal assault that was totally unwarranted and unnecessary whilst I was there.

Please pass on the thoughts above of this unprovoked attack so as to support such fabulous staff you have at the trust..

Too add, which further reinforces the unfairness of treating so poorly those who are trying to make a different
Is that one of the staff is heavily pregnant which most can’t of helped matters..

Keep us the good work , you are all superb !

Warm wishes Richard kirby

Ps I hope this attack is the exception rather than the norm..

評論內容: I don’t want to take up unnecessary A&E resources. I’ve only been there once in the past two years, after hitting my head last year. This time, I sprained my ankle and saw a doctor on Sunday, he confirmed the ligaments were injured and advised me to rest and avoid walking. However, when the pain got worse, I went back for a second opinion and saw a different doctor, hoping for an X-ray because I thought my ligaments might be torn. Instead, she told me I should walk more. Wait, what? It’s like she thinks I’m just limping for fun! The advice from the two doctors couldn’t be more different. One tells me to rest, the other tells me to walk it off. No consistency, no concern for how I’m feeling—it’s really frustrating and unprofessional.

評論內容:
I had a TAVI cardiac appointment 16/09/25, before the appointment I had a blood test ,Echocardiogram, ECG, then I saw the consultant.  All the staff were wonderful ,kind and caring. My appointments were ahead of time and the consultant was very reassuring telling me my options for heart surgery. I was dreading today and was nervous, but thanks to the wonderful staff and consultant, I now confident they will sort my heart condition out. Thank you to everyone.

UPDATE

After being told by the consultant here that I need heart surgery, plus Worthing Hospital cardiologist saying the same, this hospital is now saying there's nothing wrong with my heart and my symptoms are nothing to do with the Aeortic Stenosis!!!
How can 2 Cardiologists ,2 Echocardiograms ,2 Heart Nurses and a Physiologist at Worthing hospital all be wrong . Im left waiting now for Southampton to get back to me and for my Cardiologist at Worthing hospital who is in holiday until Monday. More stress !!

評論內容:
Aftersome recent surgery at the Princess Ann hospital I wanted to express my absolute wonder and professionalism of this hospital especially in the day surgery department. I was extremely anxious but I had over worried. Understandable as I was having a serious procedure. But I was reassured, comforted and cared for by a fantastic team of people. From my dedicated nurse to the sister I was in awe of all of them.
I watched for about 4 hours as I was prepared for my operation.
A team of professionals grafting away for a love of medical care and people. I was kept up to date, respected and understood.
I have always supported the NHS through my own experience.
In all my 50+ years of being a patient with various health conditions and issues I have always spoke up about my journey with the NHS. I have had one bad experience over many years ago but it was dealt with effectively and I was involved in seeing the positive changes that were needed.
We are all human after all.
This week I saw humanity at its best. Our NHS is loved by me and all over the world.
What makes it work it's run by the world and for that I'm forever grateful.

評論內容:
Brought my 1 year old daughter here for a heart procedure, she was premature and extremely poorly born. I was nervous, took my partner and was told on the phone that we would be entitled to Ronald McDonald housing for the time she was admitted because we had travelled so far (over 5 hours) and there was a possibility she’d need open heart surgery, I confirmed this multiple times.

The sister on the ward was extremely rude, told me “usually you’re just dropped off at the entrance we weren’t expecting both parents” in a rude way and snubbed her nose at me, even though I made them aware we were coming and CONFIRMED this. We were also told we were not entitled to any accommodation at all and to sleep in the car or pay for a hotel. She had absolutely no sympathy, Which is worrying considering she’s a children’s nurse. I was told by my daughters consultant that her procedure could result in open heart surgery so to prepare ourselves for a possible long stay (luckily she didn’t have to and it all went according to plan). I still think about this to this day, she made me feel like me being worried about my daughter was dramatic and I should have travelled 6 hours alone or been dropped off which is absolutely insane. Really wish I wrote her name down. She was an older lady, and manager/sister in PICU and the children’s wards. Hopefully she’s left, no one else should be made to feel the way I did.

I work in a hospital myself and would never ever dream about talking to a patient this way. The professional standards were disgraceful and being made to feel like a nuisance when my daughter was undergoing GA when I had previously nearly lost her multiple times was disgusting. If I could go back I would have said something to her face but as a new mum who was anxious and worried I just kept quiet. She was a disgrace.

評論內容: Unfortunately I had taken a fall and had to go to A&E due to not being able to weight bear in my right foot and it being quite swollen. The wait in A&E was only 2 hours I was brought to a cubical and straight off to X-ray two very nice ladies including a student were lovely and patient with me moving my foot. I was then whisked back to a cubical and only waited 10 minutes for the results. Turns out I had fractured my fifth metatarsal. So they gave me a shoe and some crutches and even let me see the damage done on the X-Ray. We all know times are very tough for the NHS at the moment and all of the staff are under immense pressure! But I really could not fault the service! Thank you all so much for your help!

評論內容:
For over a year I have been on a care path toward knee replacement surgery. Under the NHS Veterans charter I am entitled to at least equal consideration.
I was referred, after several knee problems and xrays, to a Surgeon. (Within the NHS) at a private provider, Spire Southampton. There i met the surgeon, who decided I needed urgent replacement of both knees, the timescale was to be around 2 months. 3 months have passed and I find that I am no longer on the  UHS waiting list, and worse, this surgeon has an NHS waiting list of around 50 weeks, according to his secretary.
Quality of care 0 out of 10. Feeling abandoned as an inconvenience 10 out of 10.  If only I had a choice.

評論內容:
I had the opportunity to be seen by Dr. Francesca Saleh at ENT Southampton after experiencing nosebleeds following nasal surgery. From the moment she arrived to assess me, everything was handled with the utmost care and professionalism.
Dr. Saleh took the time to explain clearly what she was going to do, examined the cause and source of the bleeding, and gently cleaned the area. She also prescribed medication to help prevent future bleeding. Her approach was thorough, compassionate, and extremely reassuring.
She is, without a doubt, one of the best doctors I’ve ever met – someone who performs her work with genuine dedication, responsibility, and passion. I felt safe, well-informed, and truly cared for throughout the entire consultation.

評論內容:
Thank you to the wonderful team in the Radiotherapy Department, at Southampton General Hospital.  They have looked after me so well over the past 3 days, whilst I received stereotactic radiosurgery treatments, for a small benign brain tumour.  They definitely went above and beyond with their care and reassurance.  Being claustrophobic was just one of my fears to face, but they guided me through it, at my pace, making the following treatments far more manageable. Bree, Nicky, and the rest of your team, you truly were my angels...thank you all for your expertise and empathy.
Lets hope any side effects will be just as kind to me🙏💕💖✨️

Nicky Hone

評論內容:
Ward F5

One of the worst experiences of patient care I have ever experienced. Morning rounds the ENT surgeons walk around at high speed with attitudes of sergeants in the marines, not the army, the marines!!! Just absolute robots!! No empathy, Zero beside manner, patients being left begging for a commode 4 times so they are able to access their basic human right of going to the toilet and keeping their dignity. Patients are shamed and made to feel like their pain is insignificant in the attitude that is displayed by staff. Different diagnosis made on same ward by 2 different surgeons and 2 different plans made so you don't know whether you're coming or going. I heard 2 others saying they were going to be making a complaint, sadly these were elderly people and so it is unlikely they will proceed with a complaint by the time they are better and out of there because they will want to see the back of it, but I really hope they do because otherwise if people do not raise this it will never change. My advice here will be for the staff to revisit and reflect on why they became Healthcare professionals in the first place, it may help to reignite some genuine human emotion! The amount of miscommunication I witnessed was shocking! Just a really bad experience here which is heartbreaking to say the least.
cleaned_text: ward f one of the worst experiences of patient care i have ever experienced morning rounds the ent surgeons walk around at high speed with attitudes of sergeants in the marines not the army the marines just absolute robots no empathy zero beside manner patients being left begging for a commode times so they are able to access their basic human right of going to the toilet and keeping their dignity patients are shamed and made to feel like their pain is insignificant in the attitude that is displayed by staff different diagnosis made on same ward by different surgeons and different plans made so you don t know whether you re coming or going i heard others saying they were going to be making a complaint sadly these were elderly people and so it is unlikely they will proceed with a complaint by the time they are better and out of there because they will want to see the back of it but i really hope they do because otherwise if people do not raise this it will never change my advice here will be for the staff to revisit and reflect on why they became healthcare professionals in the first place it may help to reignite some genuine human emotion the amount of miscommunication i witnessed was shocking just a really bad experience here which is heartbreaking to say the least

評論內容: My 84 year old mother, who is a lung cancer patient, and who came here last week due to agonising pain, no sleep, not eating - was sent away with no answers just told 'probably disease back because you refused chemo' (she actually physically couldn't have faced the chemo) then told just carry on taking co-codomal - even though we had said that mum was having adverse affects and not helping. For her weight loss - just told 'eat more'. Would not prescribe anything stronger for pain, just referred back to GP even when we said how impossible it has been to get an appt there. After almost a week we still have no better pain relief for my mum, GP and hospital blaming each other, meanwhile my poor mum is in terrible pain, has not slept or eaten and is going downhill fast. Shame on you Southampton for treating our elderly this way.

評論內容:
Came to Soton hospital today to see my husband who sustained an injury whilst riding his bike. I arrived about 1.15pm to be told they had no knowledge of him. I then spoke to my husband who stated he was on a trolley in Pit Stop Two, but I couldn't see him due to limited space. I was directed to Costa for a coffee, so I return about 1.30 later to be given the same negative response. Still informed that I couldn't see my husband, even for 5 minutes.
I found this approach to patient care to be totally neglectful and inconsequential.
It has been well researched to prove that family support is vitally important for the patient.

評論內容: I have not had one good experience at this hospital in approximately 40 visits in the past 3-4 years. The hospital is ill equipped for someone who is wheelchair bound. They wont let you bring your own wheelchair in the ambulance and when you get to A&E there are rarely any wheelchairs so getting to the toilet whilst waiting 4 to 5 hours is always difficult and painful if you have nerve damage in you abdomen as I have. There are wheelchairs but they are all locked up at the entrance and cost a 5 pound deposit. Transport home is a diabolical mess being challenged every time as to why you need the transport in the first place. The private subcontractor driving company do not work overnight so you end up staying over night to await transport. I have now been on a waiting list for an op for in total including pain clinic delays 3 to 4 years when the website says 15 week average. All I score this hospital as 0.5 out of 10.

評論內容:
Every visit to the hospital has been awful because of how rude the nurses and receptionists are. This time was the worst yet. The reception staff rushed me, barely let me explain my problem, and acted like they couldn’t care less. When I said I was feeling worse, one of them snapped, “She’s busy, come back in 10 minutes.”
Then a nurse in the blue curtain area looked me up and down like I was an idiot just for asking who my GP was , I’m not even from here and was just trying to understand how things work. The attitude was disgusting.
If you hate dealing with people, maybe don’t work in healthcare. Patients deserve respect, not eye-rolls and blank stares. Completely unacceptable behaviour.

評論內容: Just spent 2.5 weeks in Ward 26B after an 4.5 hour operation on 26th September. The minute I got to the Ward after I got out of ICU, I was immediately well looked after by the night nurses (got to the ward Just after 6:30pm, the operation was at 2pm). The nurses (day and night) were absolutely fantastic (Sarah, Ellie, Nat, Gloria to name a few). The physios who helped me back on my feet (Paul, Tyler, Vanessa) were and are amazing people. This hospital is way better than the run down BRI, Southmead know how to treat the patients, and their families with respect and support. I will definitely be coming back to Ward 26B for a visit or 2. Each and every single member of staff were excellent in looking after me. Oh, the food has got better as well. Nhs rocks

評論內容:
Southmead Hospital really stands out in a good way. First thing you notice is how open and spacious it feels. It doesn’t give off that cramped, stressful vibe you sometimes get in hospitals. The design is modern, bright and clean, which makes the whole place feel a lot more welcoming.

The layout is easy to follow with clear signposts, so you don’t end up wandering around lost. On top of that, they have self check in machines right at the entrance which makes appointments so much quicker and stress free.

The staff are brilliant, friendly, helpful, and they actually take the time to make sure you’re comfortable and know what’s happening. You can also tell the hospital values its volunteers. They’ve got "Move Makers" who are dotted around helping people find their way. If you’re not sure where to go, they’ll literally walk with you and make sure you get to your appointment, which makes a massive difference.

On the practical side, having an M\&S and a Costa inside the hospital is a big bonus. It makes waiting around or visiting much easier, as you’ve got proper options for food and coffee instead of just a vending machine.

Overall, Southmead feels really well thought out from the design of the building to the people working inside. It makes what could be a stressful experience a lot more positive.

評論內容: I recently had to have a toe amputated and spent 6 days in Southmead.  The staff were incredible, working in an overcrowded hospital and doing an excellent job.  The surgical team had me done in just over half an hour and half of that was waiting for the regional anaesthetic to kick in.  Immediate aftercare was with a lovely lady called Heidi who looked after me until I was sent up to gate 33, where I was taken good care of for 5 days until allowed home.

評論內容: One of the worst wait times ever experienced in an A&E. We were away on holiday and my partner woke up with a really elevated heart rate and came over unwell. 29 weeks pregnant, I took her straight to the hospital. We were there for a total of 12.5 hours from 1am until 1330. It was horrible and uncomfortable for her to be sat in the waiting room for that long. It seems that people that kept moaning were getting seen sooner. Also people that came in after and were quite clearly OK were getting seen. I know the nhs is on its knees but this place really took the piss if I'm honest. It genuinely would of been quicker for us to drive the 3 hours home and get seen at our local a&e...

評論內容: First off: the paramedics that collected me and took me to the hospital were exceptional, so full credit to them. However, the staff IN the hospital were condescending, patronising, and spoke to me as if I was a child. "The results came back OK so you should be fine!" doesn't hold up when I was vomiting bile and a little blood frequently - I lost count at 14 times. Eventually I was about to get some sleep but a practitioner arrived and said "We're not doing much for you, you can sleep at home so you should go do that." and so I got turfed out before I could even begin to recover. On top of that, nobody thought to give any medication that could've helped control symptoms which resulted in my being admitted to a far superior hospital 2 days later. A really poor showing by the staff that "treated" me.

評論內容:
To cut a long story short. I had a dermatology appointment in june 2025. Ive heard nothing since the appointment when they said they would contact me. The phone numbers on their dermatology letter are wrong so ive been trying for several days to speak to someone in dermatology by calling the main switchboard. The switchboard said i need to speak to outpatients appointments. When i got through they could only find an appointment for 2024. I rang southmead switchboard again but the numbers they keep giving me are also wrong. This morning after asking to speak to a manager or someone with authority a male member of reception staff took my details and said they would email dermatology on my behalf. I then get a phone call this afternoon from dermatology at the BRI. Obviously they couldn't find my details and said they couldn't help. What a total shambles. Why would Southmead ask the BRI to call me when i’d never been there? It is very concerning that different departments within the NHS cannot communicate with each other and cannot see my medical records. This is dangerous.
I also have other health problems but most of the NHS departments and other local hospitals don't know this as they cant even see or access my medical records.
They have also lost my next of kin from their system. Good luck if you need urgent treatment.

評論內容:
The parking situation is appalling. I had to take my 90 year old Father in Law for a routine appointment this week. After 15 minutes of trying to find a space I ended up dropping him off so he wouldn't be late for his appointment. I then tried all car parks only to be told all car parks were closed as it was unsafe to allow any more vehicles to enter the hospital grounds. I had to go and park on double yellow lines for over an hour until I tried again. This is not the first time we have had problems like this.
We arrived at 2pm for a 2.30 appointment and I finally got to his appointment at 3.30pm. 😤.

評論內容:
My blood infection streptococcus A blood infection.

On 01/04/2025 Tuesday I was Rushed into Southmead Hospital  by Ambulance.
First I was taken to Accident Emergency. Then in the early hours of  Wednesday morning I was then moved to majors injuries.
Thursday morning I was taken to Ward gate 28B
Bed 56
XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX
The Doctors informed me that I had a life threatening blood infection streptococcus A.
I was Contagious for the first four days.
From night one the Doctor's & Nurse's
pumped me through a drip in my arm very powerful combination of antibiotics all through the first four nights and the first four days. It was touch go for a while.
EVEN
Public health England phone me. to track the blood infection.
That's how serious it was taken
I informed them that don't understand  how I received this blood infection because I am House bound.
Xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx
When my partner wanted come in  to  me she was told by public health England that she had to ware PPE as a precaution. They also sent a prescription of antibiotics through the night after  they spoke to her.
This week's stay in South Mead hospital was a successful outcome.
XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX
I stayed in South Mead hospital.
From
01/04/2025 Tuesday
To.
11/04/2025 Friday
Ward gate 28B
Bed 56
My specialist doctor was called (DR EWAD)
The names of people below are only but  few out of hundreds people that helped me through my  latest stay.
SARITHA VASANTHA.        SOMAN ( NURSE )
Caroline Edge (Nurse)
LIZ (Nurse)
Morgan (Heath Care- assistant)
Sarah (Heath Care- assistant)
XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX
I like to send a enormous thank you to the people of the entire departments of accident & emergency, major injuries and a special thank you to all the people that work in Gate (Ward) 28b. From the Specialists, Doctor's, Nurse's Health Care assistants, the cleaners, cooks. The lists goes on & on of the people unknown to me which all helps to makes  (Ward) Gate 28B run smoothly.
Enormous thank you to them all.
XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX
In South Mead hospital there is NO job more superior over other jobs because they all work as part of a enormous team.
SO ONCE AGAIN I WOULD LIKE TO THANK YOU TO EVERYONE THAT WAS INVOLVED IN MY RECOVERY.
XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX
WITHOUT THESE PEOPLE MIGHT NOT BE STILL HERE BREATHING, ALIVE.
XXXXXXXXXXXX XXXXXXXXXXX X XX
FROM ANONYMOUS APPRECIATED PERSON

評論內容: Parking is, and has always been, a shambles. A huge hospital needs a huge car park. Those who are elderly, unwell, injured (or all three) cannot take the bus (which is usually unreliable) or cycle - and don't forget that the hospital has a huge catchment area so patients will often be visiting from a long way away. There simply is not enough car parking, resulting in cars circling the carparks for long periods of time whilst their drivers get increasingly angry,  frustrated and often end up in tears due to missing appointments. What is done? Well they simply close the carparks to any more cars when the problem gets particularly bad, as if that somehow solves the problem. Writing to the hospital results in meaningless management-speak replies that say nothing. Not only are no new carparks being built, but one car park has been replaced by a new building - reducing the number of parking spaces at the same time as increasing the demand. Whoever is in charge (and I use that phrase loosely) should be sacked. They won't be of course. They never are.

評論內容: My husband was attended by Louise and Chris from Ambulance 7725 at our home.  The were immediately reassuring, calm and highly professional.  Once in the hospital, they stayed with us for a couple of hours looking after my husband whilst he was held in the A&E Long Corridor Cohort 1, and could not have been nicer people to have by your side when you were worried and stressed.  The Corridor itself was well staffed by lovely Nurses and actually relatively quiet and comfortable.  My husband was later moved into an observation cubicle for a few hours whilst he was monitored and underwent several tests.  All the Nursing staff were clearly rushed off their feet but were unfailingly cheerful and professional, even when dealing with a very drunk patient. The two Doctors who saw my husband were obviously busy but patiently spent a considerable amount of time checking and evaluating my husband and were hugely professional.  We genuinely couldn't have been better looked after by the wonderfully caring and highly motivated A&E team at Southmead Hospital and would like to express our sincere and grateful thanks.

評論內容:
The antenatal team were top notch, the Quantock ward was great even though we had to really push at one point, however the theatre team that preformed the C section, completely blew my mind, the focus, professionalism, care, explaining through out and speed of the op were out of this world. It more than made up for any issue we had before hand. The transitional care team were second to none and did everything in their power to look after us. Amazing people and a amazing place. Even then security at the door , catering and cleaning staff were all great. Really made all the difference at a stressful time. Amazing.

I will say if you are there and feel like they could offer better care (in our case 2 nurses could of been more engaging, open and not try to palm us off) make that push because even though we were 3 days from our planned op, we both feel it could well of been a different outcome.

評論內容: If I were to explain every detail this review would be extremely long.  In the two and a half month's I have found that the consultant, one nurse and three nursing assistants went above and beyond.  I thank them most sincerely for the care they gave to my Son. But the Nurse in charge/ Head Nurse had the goul to call me into her office about apparently being rude.   I said to her how have I been rude?  I had no idea what she was on about.   She said you didn't say PLEASE to one of the Staff.  I told her I generally say thank you if I have asked for something.  Why would she ever think this was so important when my Son was laying in his hospital bed unconscious and not expected to improve.  Now getting onto the major issues of staff forgetting to raise my Son's backrest up after seeing to him.   So I complained to the consultant, and he said he would have word's with the staff about it.  Then I noticed my Son's daily routine notes were no longer being kept close by,  then different staff took over , and most oddly a nurse I hadn't seen before come  to ask if I had health power of attorney for my son.   I told her I  haven't and she said it doesn't make any difference anyway and walked out.   So if it doesn't make any difference WHY come in and ask me this!   Now sometime after leaving Southmead,  I still have the vision of my Son's last night there.  It's only just dawned on me the only way I could have seen him was because the bed wasn't lowered flat- while turning my Son.  I was rasied up on one elbow, in a low camp-bed and between us was a hospital bedside cabinet.  There is no way I could have seen my Son's face if he had been laying flat while being attended to, like he should have been. If I were to explain every detail this review would be extremely long. 評論內容:
I am writing to express my deep dissatisfaction with the care and handling of my late grandfather during his time at Southmead Hospital. Our experience has been distressing from start to finish, and I feel compelled to highlight the failures we encountered in the hope that no other family endures the same pain.

My grandfather was admitted due to some serious health concerns. He was discharged prematurely, only to be readmitted a few days later in what can only be described as a chaotic and disorganised manner. Upon his return, he was left waiting on an emergency ward for several days before being moved to palliative care. When I called to inquire about his location, I was merely told “Ward 9B.” At no point was it made clear to us that this was a palliative care ward - a lack of communication that added unnecessary confusion and emotional turmoil to an already difficult time.

A family member visited him on Tuesday, November 19th, and witnessed the neglect he was enduring. He was visibly uncomfortable and not being treated with the dignity and care he deserved. His food was placed out of reach, he was left in his own waste, and his skin was sore. Despite his requests for cream to ease the irritation on his arms, nurses refused, dismissing it as unhelpful. While the cream may not have cured his condition, it could have provided him some small measure of comfort in his final days. He was also approached by 3 different doctors there who told him it was 'the end of the road', this disregard for basic compassion is unacceptable.

On the day he passed away, we were fortunate to meet a nurse with blue hair (apologies for not recalling her name), who was a lovely kind and supportive lady. Her care in that moment was a small solace amid an otherwise harrowing experience.

Since his passing, the situation has only worsened. The hospital have held on to him for two weeks, rendering him unable to be dressed in the clothes our family had chosen for him. This is due to a certain doctor not showing up to planned meetings that would allow us to register his death and move on with the process. This is both shocking and heartbreaking, compounding our grief and leaving us feeling utterly devastated.

Our family is shattered by the neglect and lack of respect shown to my grandfather. We trusted your hospital to provide him with the care and dignity he deserved in his final days. That trust was completely betrayed.

評論內容:
For a hospital, I don't find that all the staff accept disabled people fairly. Like trying to take my personal wheelchair to use for other patients. I had the same nurse for 3 nights in a row trying to take my personal wheelchair for other patients, even though you can clearly see that it's not a hospital shared wheelchair. I even told her that it belonged to me.

I even had my expensive wheelchair stolen while I was induced coma and left a dirty, broken, basic wheelchair put where my wheelchair was and even attached my wash bag, etc on to the swapped wheelchair and stole my expensive gel pad cushion. Which I never had replaced, I had to buy myself a new one and gel pad cushion.

Some ambulance crews will refuse to take your wheelchair with you, "as it takes up space" in their ambulance, yet you wouldn't ask a person to leave their legs behind, my wheelchair is my legs!

評論內容: After having stage 3 cancer in my kidney and kidney removal surgery end of 2024, St George’s have basically been non existent. Completely dropped me from all situ of care, so far that I was never given my 6 month cancer scan. This led to a complicated recent MRI report where soon as it was shown on their system I had been ignored and was having issues regarding my kidney they discharged me without warning. So to be ignored for 9 months then discharged from the service soon as you can see there’s been a mistake, to me, is terrifying. Any and all attempts to complain or get help for this has been stonewalled and ignored and passed around refusing to acknowledge formal complaints. The whole thing is frankly terrifying and I’ve fully lost faith in the NHS.

評論內容:
I had a lymphoid hyperplasia at the back of my throat for over six months and it was really bothering me. After seeing several ENT specialists who did not listen to my concerns, I finally met Ms Winnie Yeung and she was amazing. She took the time to listen carefully, explained everything clearly, and arranged a biopsy straight away. I finally felt heard and cared for.

An outstanding, caring and understanding ENT Consultant and truly the best in London 👌🏽

評論內容:
I have had countless good experiences at this hospital for various different issues across a few different wards - they are exceptional. Staff are some of the friendliest I've come across in the medical world (except maybe some of the receptionists...); they are all so kind and helpful. A&E is well-triaged and quick enough (if you've come for a real reason); the maxillofacial unit is next to none - they're amazing and win all my votes; the colposcopy unit - thanks for St George's for being such an amazing hospital over the years! Your relentless efforts and hard work to serve the community do not go by unnoticed!

Oh, and anyone wanting to know these details - there are food outlets for when you're waiting and they've even got an M&S shop. Well stocked.

評論內容:
What has happened to our family is beyond appalling — it is a heartbreaking example of how catastrophically broken mental health care has become, and how badly vulnerable people are being failed by the very institutions meant to protect them.

A 19-year-old boy — vulnerable, frightened, and in crisis — was sectioned under the Mental Health Act. That should have triggered immediate, compassionate, specialist care. Instead, he was effectively abandoned.

For four days, he was confined to a small, windowless A&E room no bigger than a storage cupboard (2m x 2.5m). No proper bed. No therapeutic support. No structured care. Just left, day and night, in isolation — with his mental health spiralling further with every hour that passed. The environment was completely inappropriate for someone in acute psychological distress. It was inhumane.

Despite being sectioned — meaning he was deemed at serious risk to himself or others — there was no meaningful observation or safeguarding. The staff failed to monitor him adequately, and eventually allowed him to walk out, unsupervised, with no plan in place. Now he is missing — alone, vulnerable, and still in crisis. The hospital’s failure to act with even the most basic level of responsibility has placed him in real and immediate danger.

This was not just poor care. It was neglect. It was a total abdication of duty — both morally and legally. A young person in desperate need was treated as an inconvenience and left to deteriorate behind closed doors, while the hospital gave excuse after excuse: “We’re understaffed.” “The system is broken.” As if that justifies leaving a teenager to suffer without proper treatment — and then letting him vanish without protection.

There are no excuses for this level of failure. Vulnerable people are falling through the cracks in plain sight — and this hospital is allowing it to happen. Someone must be held accountable. There must be a serious investigation into this incident and the wider culture of neglect and inaction that enabled it.

Families entrust hospitals with the care of their loved ones during their darkest moments. What we’ve experienced is not just failure — it’s betrayal

評論內容:
I would like to express my deepest gratitude to all the wonderful staff at St George’s Hospital – Marnham  Ward. From the doctors to the nurses and healthcare assistants, every single person treated my partner with exceptional professionalism, kindness, and compassion.

During a very difficult time, you were not only medical professionals — you were a source of comfort, patience, and true humanity. Your dedication, your care, and your gentle approach made a huge difference for both of us.

Thank you from the bottom of my heart for everything you have done — for your care, your support, and for treating my partner with dignity and warmth every single day. You are all truly amazing. 🌿💙

With heartfelt appreciation,
Mihaela and partner Sandor Markovics

評論內容:
I have attended my first consultation with Mr. Andrew Martin regarding a new diagnosis of a meningioma brain tumour.
Mr. Martin's calming demeanor instantly put my husband and I at ease. He was so kind, patient and reassuring and his genuine compassion has made all the difference in helping me to make the decision regarding my care.

The brain is one of the most complex and delicate areas of the body and Mr. Martin
has a remarkable way of explaining each step clearly, answering questions in person (or via email) with patience and understanding.  This level of attentiveness builds incredible trust and trust is everything when facing surgery.

We have made our decision to proceed with the surgery knowing that I have such a committed, caring, and dedicated neurosurgeon caring for me.

評論內容:
I spent 12 hours  in A&E.

Receptionists, nurses and doctors were all very helpful and kind.

The A&E ward was full of unconventional, distinctive and colourful characters with one or two dangerous individuals (and equally dangerous security guards).

In England all 'accident and emergency' hospitals are run by the state and there are no private facilities.

Expect to see a woman with the fur coat sitting next to a someone who has soiled their trousers.

Interestingly, no one seemed to mind.

評論內容: I was blue lighted to St George's following a bike crash in August 2025 and spent a week in the Extreme Trauma ward. The skill and care of all the staff was outstanding throughout. I was given an immediate pain block in my ribs while still concussed and taken to the ward where the nursing some under tricky conditions was of a consistently high standard and some was outstanding. My speed of recovery has much to do with the treatment I received.

評論內容:
I would like to leave a comment about the hospital. The services are very slow and there is no communication between the staff. I could not understand what exactly was wrong with my daughter because every doctor gave us a different answer.

On our last visit, the orthopedic department sent us for an X-ray, and we ended up waiting there for 2 hours. The staff in the X-ray department did not even know we were waiting, because our names were not even registered in the system. At the reception, there was an employee who seemed careless – she was watching a TV series instead of doing his job. When I asked her to check, she simply told us to wait, without actually checking. I went to her two or three times, but she just kept saying “wait” and continued watching her show, as if he didn’t want to be disturbed.

In the end, I approached the X-ray staff directly, and thanks to them, we were finally able to get in. They had difficulty finding our records, which caused the 2-hour delay.

評論內容:
We would like to sincerely thank the entire maternity team at St George’s Hospital for the exceptional care, compassion, and professionalism they showed us during one of the most difficult moments of our lives.
Throughout this painful journey, the staff at St George’s walked with us every step of the way—with kindness, dignity, and empathy. From the doctors who explained everything with patience and clarity, to the nurses and midwives who not only cared for my wife medically but also comforted us emotionally, we felt supported and never alone.
Their professionalism was matched by genuine humanity. They gave us space to grieve, listened when we needed to speak, and treated our baby’s short life with respect. For this, we will always remain deeply grateful.
Thank you, St George’s Maternity Team, for being a light in our darkest hour. Your care made a painful situation bearable, and we will never forget the compassion you extended to our family.

評論內容:
Went to the A&E department after 111 giving me the ultimatum of an ambulance or my partner taking me , I had had a moterbike Acident and had really bad pain in my spine and hip.

We went to the front desk and I waited 7 hours to be seen in majors. The area then closed and I got referred bacm to minor injuries. The reception at the minors was terrible. He was telling me that I was fine and that I was just bruised even though he didn't even look at me. I was in so much pain and he would give me the same painkillers that they gave me in majours and told me I had to take paracetamol or nothing.

After about 4 hours I nearly passed out from the pain . They took me in and I got taken straight to trauma where I went on a spinal board and head cast. I was treated from there and all the doctors were amazing , I don't remember much after that , only my partner taking me home.

Such a bad experience with receptionist. He was rude and had no empathy for anyone. I cant belive he's has that kind of job.
I would never choose to back to this hospital ever again,  and have made a not with my GP also. So disappointing.

I would especially like to acknowledge Ms. Melanie Jenkins, Consultant for Thoracic Surgery, for performing my surgery. Thanks to her skill and dedication, I made a full recovery. Thank you for saving me❤️
I am truly thankful for her and the entire team. All the best!

評論內容: Just want to thank St George’s hospital for the care and attention I have been receiving for the last 15 years.  Pace making installed, ongoing monitoring and change of model, support in controlling my Arrhythmia, ablations, cardio versions - the staff may change but the ethos and professionalism is a credit to our health system.  From cleaners who are more than that (guides and greeters!), the nursing teams, pacing technicians, doctors and all those hidden support people.  Thank you for your consistency and hard work - though you make it look easy I know it takes effort.  Robin Harwood

評論內容:
I cannot fault the NHS and the experience I had when I gave birth to my first baby on the 8/8/2025. From all the pre appointments right through to the very end, I was looked after and supported.

To all the doctors and midwife’s that helped me and my husband through my plan c birth (c section) you were great. I wish I could remember your names but I cherished each and every one of you.

To the midwife that saw the tears in my eyes when baby wasn’t latching and spent 30 mins helping me and guiding me, I can now say I breastfeed with confidence.

What could’ve been a traumatic experience we were made to feel at ease and supported and I honestly thank you from the bottom of my heart for the safe delivery of my baby boy.

Thank you will never be enough.

Xxx

評論內容:
We have been transferred from Croydon University Hospital. The difference is obvious.
- Waiting in the hospital. Little Coffee places, small shops, gardens with benches all around the hospital. lovely food, reasonable prices
- Parking. I always found parking place inside the hospital, in Croydon many times I had to park in some small street in the area
- Communication: clear instructions in letter and text messages as well. The appointments has been moved forward many times
- Personal things: Everybody helpful, nice, caring. In Croydon, we always had the feeling they just want us out the door.
summary: if you still feel you have any issue with this hospital, please visit the Croydon hospital (previous name is Mayday hospital) and after you will reconsider your life, your values and belief.
I hope this review helped you to choose the right hospital.

評論內容:
My partner had a eczema flare up and it got worse during the weekend with him having fever and chills. On Monday morning he went to the ED as he could not see a GP immediately. Unfortunately the experience he had with them was gruesome.  He went in at 1.30 and only managed to get out of that place at 10 in the night.  The place was so unorganised and under staffed. He was seen initially by a doctor but the she wanted to check with someone else on what meds to prescribe. It took them hours to do this that my partner was kept waiting.  At one point he even walked to them to remind them that he has been kept waiting for more than 4 hours just to collect the prescription.  After coming home we also noticed that we were one tablet short than what was actually prescribed. So careless.

People who come to the ED are generally very sick and could not wait until they get an appointment. I cannot believe the hassle they are putting the patients through with such a bad system. I even saw patients who could not wait further and left even before being seen. We are paying heaps of money as National insurance to access good medical care. Is this being justified!?

評論內容:
To give you a quick summary of my health history I had already a terrible experience with a dermatologist at another NHS establishment. I had the expectation I would be receiving a patch test to confirm and get some clarity on some allergies I suspect. I was referred to St George's and have waited approx 4 months for a dermatologist patch test appointment. I went out of my way, having to book a half day of leave for the inconvenient appointment time and travel to tooting. After checking in I was then told that the nurse did not have the right medication to go ahead with the appointment. I had no communication via the NHS app nor text or call or anything to inform me ahead of time that this appointment could not go ahead.

This is completely unacceptable and has me really enraged that I was also completely disregarded and my only option was to reschedule for THE HOSPITAL'S error. I have now been given another appointment in september. I am really sorry but this is just not okay at all. I do not want to have to wait another 4 months for an appointment I really need.

This is now causing me a lot of undue stress for an issue that feels to have no end in sight due to the poorness of the experience I keep having with the NHS. If I was an elderly person with accessibility needs and less ease of getting to the hospital this would be absolutely unheard of. I think the treatment of this whole situation is wholly unorganised and disgusting.

Not on at all and had a really horrible experience.

評論內容:
I am incredibly grateful for the exceptional care I received from Dr. Hugh Byrne at Georges Hospital. From my very first consultation, Dr. Byrne's kindness and professionalism made a significant difference in my experience. He took the time to listen to my concerns and thoroughly answered all my questions, which truly put my mind at ease.

During my surgery, I felt completely confident knowing I was in such skilled hands. Dr. Byrne's attention to detail and dedication to ensuring a smooth procedure was evident, and his calming presence made the experience much more comfortable than I could have imagined.

What stands out the most is his genuine compassion and dedication to his patients. He always takes the time to check in and offer support, making me feel valued and cared for. I cannot recommend Dr. Hugh Byrne highly enough; he is a remarkable obstetric doctor who truly goes above and beyond for his patients. Thank you, Dr. Byrne, for everything you have done for me!

評論內容:
To the hospital management,

I am writing this complaint following an extremely disappointing experience I recently had at your facility. It was the first time I brought my son to this hospital, in an emergency situation, as he was experiencing chest pain and shortness of breath.

Unfortunately, instead of finding support, empathy, and professionalism, we were met with a careless attitude. The doctor on duty only checked his blood pressure and oxygen levels, without considering it necessary to perform an electrocardiogram or any other relevant investigations given the symptoms. After a conversation that lasted no more than two minutes, we were simply told that “everything is fine” and that we could go home. I had to insist, as a parent, for my son to at least be given an ECG.

Moreover, the staff in the paediatrics department appeared bored and uninterested, which further added to the feeling of insecurity during an already stressful moment.

I find it unacceptable that in a hospital — a place where we expect our children’s health to be treated with the utmost seriousness — we encountered a lack of involvement and medical assessments carried out in haste, with little to no communication.

I sincerely hope this complaint will be taken seriously and followed by concrete action, so that other parents and children do not have to go through a similar experience.

評論內容: My wife gave birth here recently, the staff at the maternity ward were brilliant and really made efforts to ensure my wife was comfortable. However in the Gwillim ward, it was the total opposite. The staff would constantly leave the curtain open, even when she was breastfeeding & sleeping. This is a great betrayal of privacy as my wife is uncovered at times and can be seen by people of the opposite gender without her consent or knowledge due to negligence of the staff. This caused her a great deal of stress after childbirth and really ruined our first few days with our beautiful daughter. Just a heads up if you are going to give birth at this hospital to keep an eye out. The Gwillim ward has been an absolute nightmare. The toilets were also in a state. Honestly, I am really disappointed as the maternity ward were so professional and pleasant people. The contrast was night and day. They’re the only reason why I haven’t given a 1 star review. There’s so many other things that they have done to us in this ward but I can’t even begin to describe them. Me & my wife are traumatised. I will never step foot in this hospital again. If you do come here, Anna-Marie is the only person in the Gwillim ward who has genuine care for her patients. She goes the extra mile. The rest should look towards her and learn from her.

評論內容:
A REAL emergency

The 20th of May of 2023 a young doctor saw me in  A&E, she was great. At that point I was tired of doctors diagnosing me by looking at my face (I was looking great! Yeah! But dying). She was the doctor that asked me to go back on Monday 22nd because my platelets were around 50000 and it was really worrying. I consider, that after 3 years suffering a cancer without knowing, she saved my life just with her concern. She wanted me going back to the hospital on Monday so an Hematologist could see me. To this doctor, thank you. So young and so professional, some can learn from you.

A different experience was the 22nd. When I said I was there on Saturday they looked at me as I was crazy. I told them the doctor left a note for them and they looked for it, I was right.I said I was not leaving until someone could say to me what was happening in my body. I had a doctor rolling the eyes on my, asking me silly questions but at that point I just wanted him to look at my massive spleen. They made me wait 8 hours. The doctor saw me twice and at some point he said “you deserve  I call to the Hematology Department to get an appointment for you”, I deserve… he said. He called (I am grateful for that) and the hematologist came immediately to see me. To this incompetent doctor, you are lucky I did not die. You should not be a doctor.

The hematologist started asking questions to me, I had another blood test (she made the incompetent doctor to do it, and he apologized), and in 30 minutes she told me I could have LEUKAEMIA or lymphoma. To this wonderful Hematologist, you definitely saved my life! (also my dignity) There is not a score for this.

I would love to know the name of the two female doctors that helped me to survive to thank them. Without them my spleen would have broken soon. It was difficult for me to find you, two  professional and competent doctors. Thank you.

評論內容: I had a C.T. Scan this morning (25/02/25), I didn’t get the young man or his female colleagues name but wanted to say thank you. My appointment was booked for 9-15, I was seen on time in an already very busy department. This young man wasn’t to know that outwardly he was dealing with a 55 year old woman but he also didn’t know that inside that 55 year old is a 2 year old fighting to get out when it comes to hospitals, when the contrast was put through,  my heart started pounding really hard, scared the granny out of me, thought I was going to have an out of body experience but his bedside manner was commendable. He treated me with kindness and compassion which is everything. Very impressed with St George’s. On a separate note, I also had to call the Transport Dept today to book for an elderly aunts appointment which I was having a few issues with. I got to speak to Andrea in Transport who was kindness itself and she sorted everything out for us and called me back as promised. Again another great ambassador for St George’s, her kindness, compassion and decency was truly appreciated.

評論內容:
Today I had a blood test, it was my first ever one and was a little nervous.

Ulam, was the Doctor doing my blood test, who made me feel very comfortable. After the test I passed out a little, which they dealt with amazingly, I was very scared when I first woke up, Ulam and another Doctor called Edyta made my space private, gave me water and made sure I was calm and sat down until I came back around. They very kindly even gave me some chocolate as I had not had much to eat. Feel a lot better now and they way they dealt with it will make me more comfortable the next time I need a blood test.

Thank you again Dr. Ulam and Dr. Edyta, have a lovely weekend!

評論內容: This hospital is the most amazing hospital I have ever experienced. My son was admitted via A&E after a road accident. The best care, compassion not just for him but for the whole family. I cannot begin to explain just how attentive the staff were. He received care so quickly and this was at the weekend! The ward was homely and they provided drink and snacks which is what you need when you are in shock. The aftercare from the trauma team was quick and before we left my son was able to talk to someone. I cannot begin to put into words how much this all meant to the whole family. You made the worst day of our life’s felt like it was so important to everyone. Not at any point did I feel he wasn’t getting what he needed. You all deserve a medal. I work in care myself and this has made me feel so proud. We must all value each and every nurse because this country would be a complete mess without them. I just hope you all go home knowing how great and appreciated you all are. I want to thank you ALL from the very bottom of my heart ❤️

評論內容:
My daughter came here last month whilst undergoing cancer treatment, the nurses were so rough with her when trying to insert a port needle she now has night terrors every night.

It took 2 grown women to hold down a 4yr old, there was no care or compassion for a little girl who has suffered enough pain she was just treated like a piece of meat.

And yet they managed to insert a needle once a week for 6 weeks for radiotherapy at The Royal Marsden without absolutely terrifying her, treating scared and sick children with compassion and dignity is possible, it’s just not possible here.

Twice now we’ve had to come here and twice it’s been an ordeal, never again.

評論內容:
Pockets of this hospital are lovely,  and so are individual members of staff, but departments do not communicate with each other, and this results in a confusing journey around the hospital.  I must say A&E staff were brilliant, but 8 hours to be admitted was not, and that was after 4 hours spent in A&E at Epsom!!

The Nye Bevan unit was lovely overnight,but the daytime reception staff were not friendly.  We all know the NHS is struggling, but this experience did not install confidence.

Security staff on the other hand need to be commended.  Their presence was reassuring, and they were extremely friendly and approachable.

This is just my experience; others may not have the same experience.

評論內容:
I am writing this after finally being diagnosed with stage 4 endometriosis in Italy, where I will now undergo surgery. Months of my life were wasted in unbearable pain because your hospital failed to identify the problem and instead misdiagnosed me with “appendix” or “renal colic.”

I came to your A&E around 9.30 PM in February 2025 and I left the day after at 11.45 AM (more than 12H!), with relentless, debilitating pain, clearly linked to my menstrual cycle, yet your doctors failed to listen, failed to investigate appropriately, and ultimately failed me as a patient.

Despite my repeated insistence that this was not flank pain, not renal colic, and not appendicitis, I was dismissed, misdiagnosed, and sent away with codeine and suppositories and other painkillers. I explicitly told Dr Simon Pearson that, due to my medical history of UTIs, I would be able to recognise kidney-related pain. A CT scan later confirmed that my kidneys were fine and my appendix was normal. Yet no further investigation was pursued. Instead, I was left in agony, forced to endure unnecessary scans, pointless medication, and most importantly, the loss of crucial months of my life.

I repeat, this way maybe you get to take this into consideration, I now have a confirmed diagnosis of stage 4 endometriosis. A diagnosis that your hospital failed to even consider, despite the obvious pattern of severe, period-related pain. This level of incompetence is not just unacceptable, it is dangerous. By dismissing patients and masking symptoms with painkillers rather than identifying the root cause, you are not treating people; you are prolonging their suffering and worsening their conditions. It is shocking that doctors rely on guesswork, online and AI searches instead of listening to patients and investigating thoroughly. You are not treating people,  you are experimenting on them and covering up your failures with pills. If someone presents with severe, cyclical pain during menstruation, endometriosis should at least be part of the discussion.

The negligence and incompetence I experienced here caused me unnecessary suffering, delays in diagnosis, and loss of quality of life. Patients deserve better than to be dismissed, misdiagnosed, and given pills as a quick fix.

I will never forgive this failure in care.

評論內容: This hospital failed my mother several times while she was battling cancer, they delayed her having a hysterectomy which led to her stage 1 cancer progressing to stage 4 and they established this while she was on the surgery table!! I had to come to the hospital daily to care for my mother due to them being short staffed, they forgot to give her and other patients their medication and food!! I made several complaints and was scared to leave her overnight, she had to have surgery to drain fluid from her lungs and was told this was a simple procedure and non life threatening but due to shortage of on call doctors a new nurse carried out the procedure and incorrectly inserted the drain and my mum died!!!!! She fought so hard to battle this disease just for her life to be taken due to negligence, my life is ruined and my family torn apart by something that could have been avoided.

評論內容:
Where to start !
I went to the emergency after calling 111. The man on the phone said go there and we will transfer the info to the emergency services. It was 2 am I could bearly walk and took an Uber there. Arrived at the emergency the secretary said that they did not receive any detail as they stopped doing that few months ago. Then I was taken for blood test and breathing test. Both of them were performed horrible as the doctor was really not gentle. Then we have been put in the waiting room. They were only 5 people waiting we were not many and then only 2 people waiting including me. We waited not 1h or 2h we waited 5h and they were not able to give us an update on when we can see a doctor. I was suffering in my chair and waiting room they did NOT care at all!!! I decided to ask the nurse there who was extremely rude. I shortly realised after that 0 doctor where in the emergency services !!!! It is shocking . Simply no one was there and they were not willing to take care of me. After a long time waiting I was unable to sit in the chair anymore and it was annoying me so much. The sun came out and I simply left .
People who were seen by the doctors were said to go back home despite their obvious struggles.
I took a risk by leaving but would rather take a flight to a developed country and do proper checks there by competent staff. It is worse than what I imagine. Leaving the uk is not an option anymore. Can’t rely on the medical system which is the most important aspect to asses in a country.
They could at least be nice, compassionate and polite

評論內容:
Was left for 8+ hours alone in a room during an adrenal crisis. When I begged for help, the nurse told me to shut up and wait.
Woke up to a crash team trying to revive me. Covered in blood and vomit.
Would have been avoided if she'd just given me IV hydrocortisone as is standard for injured/sick people with Addison's disease.
Would be 1 star but the morning shift doctor realised my condition and got the hydrocortisone and managed to stabilise me and fix the nurse's negligence.

The effect of the poor response of the ward meant I had to spend months in hospital for a stomach virus.

評論內容: Cannot fault the experience we’ve had here today! My mum was referred here for a liver assessment and every single member of staff that we have seen throughout the day has gone above and beyond for us. Although hospitals aren’t the nicest place you want to be, they made sure everything ran smoothly for us, explained everything in great detail and kept us in the loop every step of the way. Kerry, the coordinator who saw us on the Lincoln wing and then on the Bexley wing was so approachable and kind and truly made us feel like no question was too silly to ask. Honestly thank you so much, you have really given us all some hope with my mum for the future x

評論內容: it took me a while to be seen (thursday evening) but not as long as i expected. i was sent to a second waiting room after waiting in the first one for about half an hour which i thought was a bit counterintuitive, but i understand that this new system may work better than the older one. i was impressed with the nurse who saw me as she was lovely and dealt with my issue efficiently and as painlessly as possible, and made me feel at ease by joking around and chatting with me as i was quite nervous, and gave me as much time as i needed to prepare myself. i can’t remember her name but i could not recommend her enough. my injury was quite a stupid one but i didn’t feel judged at all by any of the staff, quite the opposite, i cannot thank them enough. it was overall an ideal hospital experience given the circumstances and i recommend here over leeds general any day.

評論內容:
Honestly, the care, compassion, fun, I have received from every nurse, radiotherapist, health care, kitchen staff, cleaner, volunteer, has been outstanding!!

The brachytherapy/radiology department- outstanding!! I want to thank you from the bottom
Of my heart, Beautiful people, who work as a team, are empathetic and caring! Couldn’t do more to make you feel at ease, settled and calm.
Informed me of every procedure and answered all my questions.
Honestly you guys are the best!
What a team!! If I wanted a job at a hospital I would come work with you guys, I love how you work with one another and how attentive you are to all your patients,  It was so lovely to see.
I appreciate you all staying behind and looking after me on the long days!! Giving up time with your own tallies to help me, will never forget you guys.Chinese Tuesdays 😁

MRI team- beautiful people, I appreciate you guys so much, the work you do is amazing.
Thank you!

Radiotherapy-2 again greeted at reception with smiles, the ladies on the desk couldn’t do enough for me, explaining step by step how my  day would look? Thank you for making me smile and keeping me going on some difficult days. Lovely ladies who are fab at their job! Lucky to have you sat on that desk.

You guys in -2 radiotherapy, had the patients of  a saint with me, and I am so very grateful to you all for being so understanding, and making me feel as ease, again!! going over my treatment plan with me, with care and plenty of empathy!you guys rock!!!

Chemo ward J80
Now you guys are special,  attentive, caring, fun,
I didn’t know what to expect but you guys kept me calm and reassured!! Thank you from the bottom of my heart! Keep up amazing work, because people like me appreciate all you do and are truly grateful! The hot chocolate  on that ward was also beautiful, and biscuits😁 kept us all going.
Thank you!

Special thank you to Dr Coan. For always going above and beyond! And putting up with me. Thank you for everything.

評論內容:
Most of my experience was fine (long wait times but that’s to be expected), the main reason I’m leaving this review is because of the HORRIBLE nurse who took my blood.

She first handled my urine sample (which was loose as they had run out of urine sample kits) and then proceeded to walk around restocking needles and typing on the keyboard with the same gloves she had used for my urine …

She then called me to take my blood (all while not having changed her gloves), when I asked her if she could please change them she told me she already had (she had not, I had been watching her the whole time). I then insisted she change them anyway.

Before taking my blood I informed her I have vasovagal and am prone to fainting and vomiting when having blood drawn or needles in my body in general. Usually, any reasonable medical practitioner would ask you to lie down after this, she did not. After struggling to find a vein for a while (I’ve never had any issues with people finding my veins by the way, I’ve actually been told I have “good veins” in the past - but that’s not relevant), she finally found one and proceeded to try to take my blood, then failed miserably by keeping the needle in my arm for a solid 4-5 minutes which caused me to faint and vomit. Throughout the process I told her that I was not feeling well, that I was nauseous and that I felt faint and she proceeded by telling me it was “just a few more seconds”. After I woke up from fainting and told her I was going to vomit she did absolutely nothing and it was a nurse from outside the room who came in running with a bowl for me to be sick in.

This was obviously very traumatic so I was crying, and whilst crying, after being sick and fainting she then asked me to take my own vomit and dispose of it in the toilet.

To top this whole fantastic experience off, when I saw the doctor he told me that the blood test didn’t work and so I had to retake it, so that was all for absolutely nothing (and I had to spend an additional 3 hours in A&E).

Don’t know what her name was but whoever is running the hospital needs to conduct a serious investigation.

評論內容:
I was admitted to St Thomas’ Hospital with acute appendicitis two days ago. I was told my surgery would take place yesterday, then it was postponed to today, and now I’ve just been informed it will be tomorrow, with no specific time given.
I have not been allowed to eat for two days while waiting for surgery, which has made this experience even more difficult.

I understand that hospitals can be busy and emergencies happen, but it’s very stressful to wait for several days in pain and without clear communication or a definite schedule. I would really appreciate more transparency and timely updates about surgical timing and patient care planning.

The nursing staff have been kind, but the repeated delays and lack of clear information are very hard to handle as a patient.

I just hope I can get out of this situation well in the name of God🙏

評論內容:
Sadly, on Saturday evening 18th October, Mother-in-Law had to be ambulanced to A&E at St. Thomas' Hospital, Westminster Bridge Road, London.

She's on the mend now but not after being cared for with great compassion by Sharlene, Max and others (whose names I didn't get, sorry).

It's a hospital and not somewhere one wishes to be BUT, under such circumstances, team A&E on Saturday evening were consummate professionals and we are all very, very grateful indeed.

Thank you Sharlene, Max, colleagues and Josh & Hollie from the London Ambulance Service as well.

Keep safe and well, kindest regards and thanks to you all... the NHS are very lucky to have you.

評論內容: Ospedale molto moderno ,medici abbastanza competenti,ma non quelli del pronto soccorso. Sono stata ieri dopo una lunga attesa per uno Squilibrio significativo neuro muscolare e scheletrico. Forte dolore nella parte molle costola sinistra e forte contrattura torace posteriore con rotazione .debolezza lato sinistro del corpo . Che mi impedisce di espandere il torace e respirare bene .Compressione nervi cranici viso  e formicolio piedi e gambe Il medico di turno non mi ha visitata né ascoltata nonostante è un anno e mezzo che mi aggravò sempre di più e nonostante io abbia il lupus erimatoso sistemico malattia autoimmune seria  e sono immunosoppressa. Nonostante non riesco a deglutire e la lingua è tesa a causa di un ponte gravemente incogruo che mi ha cambiato l anatomia della bocca e spostato l osso mascellare e mandibola.Mi ha fatto uscire fuori e ha voluto parlare con mia figlia che non è a conoscenza di tutti i sintomi e alla fine sto sempre in questo stato nemmeno una visita neurologic.a  . Mi sono sentita un numero psicologicamente provata . aggiornamento sono ancora senza cure malata Reumatologica con collasso ossa mascelllari e facciali palato chiuso un dito di spazio osso deviato la lingua non funziona non ha spazio mi soffoca in tensione e arretra la gola e il palato e i muscoli sono chiusi arcuato le ossa zigomatiche collassate ho compressione cranica forte i muscoli facciali non funzionano la malattia autoimmine sta attaccando giorno per giorno le ossa i muscoli tessuti molli dove chiudo lo spazio orale le mandibole si sono chiuse deformate non respiro bene le arcate sono collassate l' osso è avanzato sono arrivata in autobulanza perché la lingua tesa mi soffocava . Non mi hanno fatto nessuna visita nemmeno un ent eppure ho referto che il palato e arcuato  hanno scritto che hanno fatto  Blood test non E vero . Mi hanno mandata a casa . Ho dolore alla testa mi sento scoppiare . Stamattina non riuscivo a respirare e aprire la bocca la faccia . Hanno detto finché i parametri sono buoni stai così . Aspettano che si chiude tutto completamente e le ossa non si possono più allargare . Le malattie Autoimmuni sono gravi  mi dovevano ricoverare immediatamente e fermare l infiammazione sistemica . Invece mi stanno facendo morire ormai e troppo tardi . In  2 anni poteva aiutarmi nhs nessuno lo ha fatto sto morendo i GP solo refferal per maxillofaccial dolore ma mai ho avuto una visita da un senior per caso rari e complessi cranio facciali orali ,solo giovani assistenti per dolore che non capiscono nulla delle ossa . Sono sola ogni giorno combatto per un po' di respiro e cercare di allargare la faccia che si chiude pure la bocca da 2 anni sto dicendo che la lingua e6 intrappolata e che parlo s fatica in un dito di spazio che e tesa non mi nutro non posso deglutire bene sono grave . Vergogna in Burundi mi avrebbero curata . Addirittura hanno chiamato la dottoressa mental healt che ha accettato che la mia non è malattia mentale ma sofferenza fisica . E nemmeno in questo caso ho ricevuto aiuto . I would like to express my sincere gratitude to the staff members of the Emergency and X-ray departments at St Thomas' Hospital for their swift and professional care during my visit on 27/08/2025. I was suffering from a painful left shoulder dislocation, and the prompt attention, reassurance, and medical support I received made a difficult experience much more bearable.
A special thank you to Mr. Chad Parkes, the male nurse who attended to me with exceptional kindness, professionalism, and efficiency. His calm and compassionate approach truly stood out and brought great comfort during a painful time.
Thank you all for your dedication and outstanding service.
Warm regards,
Zain ul Abidin Sheikh
Patient Number #40165108

評論內容:
One of the UK’s most respected hospitals, St Thomas’ sits right on the Thames across from Big Ben — a location as iconic as its care 🏛️🌉. Part of Guy’s and St Thomas’ NHS Foundation Trust, it’s internationally recognized for cardiology, maternity, intensive care, and emergency medicine.

As a teaching hospital partnered with King’s College London, it’s also a hub for cutting-edge research, training future doctors while delivering world-class treatment. Facilities are modern and well-equipped, but what makes the difference is the staff — professional, compassionate, and remarkably dedicated even under pressure.

評論內容:
Just for  Dr Simon Atkinson!!
had a surgery done in the st thomas hospital for gallbladder removal by this dr ..very bad experience!! After just couple of weeks, i started having very big pain, so i went back to the emergency..and nothing happened. I requested an appointment again with the dr atkinson, and after a ct scan, nothing. I tried to explain to him that I am feeling very bad and in big pain, his answer was that there is nothing that he can do, so they didn't go ahead with further investigation and just discharged me ,so I am living life for 2 years with the big pain. The story's that you see on other social media and that he cares about his patients is not true. It is so sad because even after my surgery he didn't come to visit me to check how I am. I asked the nurse if I need a specific diet and they asked me what did the doctor say but the doctor hadn't even come to visit me after surgery so I didn't know. So this is the big doctor that ruined my life!!

評論內容: The most DISORGANISED hospital I have even seen. Unable to get to maternity unit as  the numbers online don't even exist and the ones that I have been given after desperately calling other units in the hospital are not picked up by any staff no matter how long you hold or what time of the day you call in. Clearly noone bothers to update their records online or actually do their job as an organisation to help the public by at least picking up their "helplines". Not to mention how poor customer service is, 0 manners whatsoever, majority don't even speak clearly. I had the unpleasant experience of talking to a male from the scan unit who answered the phone number ending 8003 and was extremely rude picking up the phone and then hanged up when I was half way through my sentence. Upon calling back he's said he would put me through maternity unit he put me through some dermatology department. I gave it another go since it was the only number picking up and then he put me through general enquiries line where a robot basically told me that they are very busy to take any calls and again I was hunged up on. I called another unit and asked if there is a maternity unit number that works at all and if there is anyone who would actually pick it up. She said she has been complaining to management for so long because people are calling her line with this sort of requests but management have done nothing to reflect the issue. Absolutely awful customer service. Biggest mistake ever was trusting this hospital with my maternity care. I am out of here and being transferred over to another hospital.

評論內容:
My mother is currently in hospital and has been for almost 2 weeks. The care is awful and it seems none of the staff members communicate!
I had to come down to the hospital at 11pm to speak to the nurses as I hadn’t been able to get through to them all day. Whilst I appreciate they are busy and have other patients, I discovered that my mum has been neglected whilst being here. A needle was left on her bedside table from earlier in the day. She also needs to be put back on fluids and antibiotics which a staff member agrees with me about this but it took for me to go there to sort this out! My grandmother also had a bad experience a few years ago when she was punched in the arm by a nurse but was too scared to report it as she was constantly in and out of this hospital and didn’t want any comebacks from it. Very angry and disappointed in this hospital. Thought they were supposed to care and treat patients with respect and dignity! But if you treat the staff the way they treat patients you will be thrown out. Disgusting

I had such a great experience at St Thomas’ Hospital while on holidays in London. Being from Australia and travelling home the next day, I felt a bit unsure and overwhelmed about going to a hospital in another country, but the care I received was excellent.

A big thank you to Dr McCullough who was so attentive, quick to help, and very thorough. He explained everything clearly and made sure I felt comfortable and understood throughout the whole process.

Really grateful for the service and support — it made all the difference before heading home!

評論內容:
I have been visiting the Input Pain Management dept for more than 15 years, initially under Dr Padfield, but following his retirement, under Dr Smith. The level of patient care he provides is first class. The treatment area for procedures is modern, spotlessly clean, and you always get seen promptly.

Everyone in the department is so friendly, professional and welcoming, especially the nursing staff. Plus, Tracy in the bookings team is an absolute star. She has never failed to help me when I've called to book my follow-up procedures.

Together, this is an example of the very best of the NHS, and a team which deserves to be recognised for doing a fantastic job. Thank you.

評論內容:
I have never been treated SO well not even when I was a child.

I attended yesterday for a laparoscopy due to endometriosis and every member of the surgical ward and team was absolutely fantastic.

I didn’t think service like this existed in the NHS. Everyone was kind and respectful without treating me like I’m a bit thick like some health professionals have the tendency too.

I genuinely can’t fault anyone or anything. The operation was fantastic and for the first time in a long time I didn’t throw up after the aesthetic and got to go home the same day.

They even gave me copies of my internal photos for me to keep personally.

It’s been a long time since I came out of any experience, not just a hospital and couldn’t improve upon a single thing (apart from my boyfriend not buying me flowers haha).

A true jewel in the crown of the NHS. Everyone who I interacted with from receptionist to surgical staff was a credit to their team, professional, and the NHS.

Fantastic work, keep it up!

評論內容:
I once came here the day after I broke my humerus and was left with lasting psychological trauma. I was placed in a hospital bed, where a Black nurse verbally humiliated me — taunting me about why I was crying, asking what there was to cry about, and treating me with impatience. In the middle of taking my blood, she left abruptly to fetch something, leaving me with a fractured left hand and swelling in my right hand, making it impossible for me to even get myself a glass of water.

The carer who applied my cast was also unprofessional and caused me unnecessary pain, which has since left me with anxiety and depressive feelings whenever I think of this hospital. This was, without question, the worst medical experience I’ve had in the UK, and I am deeply disappointed.
